result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Rodriguez James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or attend school.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may be present for the birth of his child if approved by the victim.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
01-22-16/ Judge Janet Protasiewicz
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.
As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Rodriguez James

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time.

Defendant Carlos Rodriguez James not in court.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (30 days straight time).
Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Carlos Rodriguez James in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or school.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may be present for the birth of his child if approved by the victim.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no sample was taken.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment and/or attend school.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 666
cf

Defendant Carlos Rodriguez James in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Opening statements made by the state and the defense. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Trial proceeded.  Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 received. Sworn for the state: Ofc. Rolando Gonzalez, MPD, Kenneth Morgan, 911 dispatcher. State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense's motion for directed verdict denied. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court makes a finding of guilt. Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Case adjourned in branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carlos Rodriguez James in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Carlos Rodriguez James in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
